title: Ticket #1762: Core limits not set correctly for DAG node jobs
description: Todd M ran into this problem, and I've done a bit of investigating -- it seems like DAG node jobs end up with a core size limit of 0, unless CREATE_CORE_FILES is true for the schedd. It seems like something in daemoncore sets the soft limit to 0 inside the DAGMan process.
remarks:
2010-Nov-08 21:04:48 by wenger:
I've done some investigating, and what's going on is this: In check_core_files() in daemon_core_main.cpp, RLIMIT_CORE gets set to zero if the param CREATE_CORE_FILES is false. The manual says that CREATE_CORE_FILES defaults to undefined, but it actually seems to default to false. So by the time the DAGMan process is going to run condor_submit for a node job, its own soft core limit has been set to zero unless CREATE_CORE_FILES is true. Condor_submit then inherits the core limit from DAGMan, and sets CoreSize accordingly.

So the summary is that CREATE_CORE_FILES, which is supposed to apply to the Condor daemons, ends up also applying to any DAG node jobs.

2010-Dec-03 16:54:45 by wenger:
This got fixed (and documented) a few weeks ago, but for some reason I forgot to resolve the ticket, so I'll do that now...
